text.section: In order to foster the development of a consolidated system of public higher education, to improve the quality of education, to extend its benefits and to encourage the economical use of the State's resources, the University System of Maryland is established in accordance with the provisions of this title.

section.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Board" or "Board of Regents" means the Board of Regents of the University System of Maryland.
"Chancellor" means the Chief Executive Officer of the University System of Maryland and the Chief of Staff for the Board of Regents.
"President" means the Chief Executive Officer of a constituent institution of the University System of Maryland.
"University" or "University of Maryland" or "University of Maryland System" means the University System of Maryland.
"Computer-based instructional technology" means computer hardware or software used by faculty and students in the delivery of the instructional program.
